articles.author: Mariya Gordeyeva
articles.description: An Embraer passenger plane flying from Azerbaijan to Russia crashed near the city of Aktau in Kazakhstan on Wednesday with 62 passengers and five crew on board, Kazakh authorities announced, saying that 27 people had survived.
articles.title: Passenger plane flying from Azerbaijan to Russia crashes in Kazakhstan with many feared dead

articles.author: Pavel Polityuk
articles.description: Russia attacked Ukraine's energy system and cities in its eastern region with cruise and ballistic missiles on Wednesday morning, Ukraine's energy minister and local officials said.
articles.title: Russia attacks Ukraine energy system in major missile strike, Kyiv says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Palestinian militant group Hamas said on Wednesday Israel has set new conditions that have led to delays in reaching a Gaza ceasefire agreement.
articles.title: Hamas says Israel's new conditions have delayed ceasefire agreement

articles.author: Liz Lee, Sakura Murakami
articles.description: Talks on seafood trade are expected to be on the agenda on Wednesday when Japan's foreign minister visits China, Japan's largest export market for aquatic products until Beijing placed a blanket ban in protest against Tokyo releasing treated radioactive wastewater into the ocean.
articles.title: China, Japan foreign ministers meet in Beijing, seafood trade on agenda

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan said on Wednesday that Kurdish militants in Syria will either lay down their weapons or "be buried", amid hostilities between Turkey-backed Syrian fighters and the militants since the fall of Bashar al-Assad this month.
articles.title: Kurdish militia in Syria will be buried if they do not lay down arms, Turkey's Erdogan says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Authorities in Russia's southern Krasnodar region on Wednesday declared a region-wide emergency, saying that oil was still washing up on the coastline 10 days after two ageing tankers ran into trouble.
articles.title: Russian region declares emergency situation as Black Sea oil spill fallout widens

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hundreds of university students rallied in Belgrade on Wednesday to protest the policies of President Aleksandar Vucic and his ruling Serbian Progressive Party (SNS), whom they blame for a railway disaster last month in which 15 people died.
articles.title: Serbian students march in Belgrade to protest train station disaster

articles.author: Ank Kuipers
articles.description: Suriname's fugitive ex-President Desi Bouterse has died aged 79, the country's government said on Wednesday, almost a year after he fled authorities to avoid jail following his conviction over the murder of 15 political activists in 1982.
articles.title: Suriname ex-president Desi Bouterse dead at 79, foreign minister says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian cargo ship called Ursa Major which sank in the Mediterranean Sea was the victim of "an act of terrorism," state news agency RIA cited the vessel's owner as saying on Wednesday.
articles.title: Russian cargo ship which sank off Spanish coast was victim of 'act of terrorism,' RIA cites owner

articles.author: Minwoo Park
articles.description: South Korea's suspended President Yoon Suk Yeol did not respond on Wednesday to a second summons by anti-corruption authorities who, along with prosecutors, are investigating his short-lived martial law decree issued early this month.
articles.title: South Korea's Yoon defies second agency summons over martial law
